badge_template_activities.title: This individual has successfully completed a classroom assessment proving their knowledge of the following:

Governance and control across the project lifecycle, using recognised tools and techniques.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has successfully completed a classroom assessment proving their knowledge of the following:

The use of appropriate methods to interact with data sources (e.g. API, Database) and manage application data (e.g. SQL, Object Relational Mapper).
Operating system portability and appropriate protocols for software interoperability across distributed platforms (e.g. SNMP, HTTP).
Software testing, issue management, configuration management, release management, software maintenance and security standards.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has successfully completed an industry-accredited degree apprenticeship which proved that they can:
Understand how business exploits technology solutions for competitive advantage.
Design, implement, test and debug software to meet business and technical requirements, and specify, configure and deploy technology solutions.
Model and implement database solutions, manage data effectively and securely, and undertake data analysis.
Risk assess a simple IT system, and identify threats to current or planned systems and services.
Apply an understanding of organisational theory, change management, marketing, strategic practice, human resource management and IT service management to technology solutions development.
Manage small IT projects to meet business needs, including planning, execution, control, risk management and closure, utilising industry standard methodologies and tools.
Plan, design and manage computer networks to deliver business value.
Communicate fluently, including articulating complex issues, making presentations, influencing others, and providing and receiving feedback.
Apply analytical and critical thinking to solutions development, conduct effective research, and secure commitment to solutions with basic negotiation skills.
Additional role-specific expertise is noted in ‘evidence’ below.

alignments.name: Tech Industry Gold
alignments.description: Tech Industry Gold is the industry accreditation for tech and digital skills. badge_template_activities.title: This individual has successfully completed a classroom assessment proving their knowledge of the following:
Technical foundations including systems development lifecycle stages, data management and analysis, use of visualisation tools, safety and security.

Principles, methods and tools for seamlessly integrating interdependent services from internal and external providers into end-to-end services to meet business requirements and offer effective customer and application support.
Processes for managing the lifecycle of incidents to ensure normal service operation is restored as quickly as possible, with effective communication between stakeholders to limit impact.

Principles and components of operating systems that aim to ensure safe and secure operations, including methods for Identity and Access Management (IAM) and automation of routine system administration tasks.
Monitoring and maintaining the secure operation of a system through backups, log management and implementation of measures to prevent risks associated with typical (physical) system vulnerabilities.
Infrastructure planning and configuration, including capacity management, storage and file systems, virtualisation and cloud-based services.
Monitoring and improving network services including access control.
Business understanding including the application of technology to deliver business value, risk management, and regulation and compliance.
Project management processes and tools, including planning, delivery, evaluation and the management of, quality, stakeholder communications and risk.
Professional skills including client communications, teamwork, self-direction and personal performance improvement.
Click here for further information

17cda270-8d1d-435d-a348-f0ff4c098dcf.description: This individual has a broad understanding of technology in business, and skills including IT consulting, project management, change management, business case development, and the design and implementation of simple technology systems. They have successfully completed a Tech Industry Gold accredited degree. Supported by employers, this meets industry skills standards for employability in entry level roles, with a holistic blend of technical, business, project and professional skills.
17cda270-8d1d-435d-a348-f0ff4c098dcf.name: Computer Science with Management (ITMB)- Queen Mary University London

issuer.summary: issued by TechSkills, a techUK company

alignments.name: Tech Industry Gold
alignments.description: Tech Industry Gold is the industry accreditation for tech and digital skills. Successful completers of Tech Industry Gold accredited programmes have met industry standards covering the holistic blend of technical, business, project and professional skills required for job readiness. Tech Industry Gold is led by employers and managed by TechSkills.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has successfully completed an industry-accredited degree which proved the following knowledge and skills:
A fundamental understanding of business strategy and processes, the role and management of information systems in business, information security and risk management.
The ability to apply IT consulting methodologies to deliver business improvement, including interacting with clients, influencing action and managing scope.
An understanding of how to deliver sustainable change management, taking account of technical, cultural and environmental factors.
The ability to construct a basic business investment case for a new technology solution, to manage budgets, and to understand basic accounting principles.
Understanding of the technical foundations of systems analysis and design, software development, data management, service delivery, operations management and systems integration.
Familiarity with different enterprise architecture models, including how to describe the structure and behaviour of applications, consumption of data and interactions with users.

Understanding of the principles of IT Operations management to support business processes and customer service; the fundamentals of software testing and solution evaluation; and the use of machine learning and artificial intelligence.
The ability to design a simple network and cloud-hosted virtual environment, based on an understanding of distributed computing for digital network and cloud computing systems and their security.
The ability to apply modern project management methodologies to plan, deliver, manage risk and report on a technology-enabled project to achieve organisational goals.
Professional skills including written and verbal communications, teamwork, evidence-based problem solving and effective work behaviours.
Click here for further information

badge_template_activities.title: This individual was judged to be a winner in the Business Contribution section of the 2022 National Awards. They were nominated by their employer and / or university for the exceptional contribution they made to their employer’s business during their degree apprenticeship programme.

5a1a68f0-9e15-4631-97de-1af129d59db8.description: This individual was a member of a team commended by the employer panel judging the annual Tech Industry Gold student competition. Teams put forward proposals for the novel application of technology to solve real world problems. National Student Team Competitions are part of the experience offered to students on Tech Industry Gold accredited degree programmes, to help develop the holistic blend of technical, business, project and professional skills required for job readiness.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual was a member of a student team which demonstrated the following:
The initiative to form a self-directed team to enter a national competition judged by employers.
An innovative concept for the application of technology to solve a real- world problem.
Project management skills to develop the concept and its presentation within a given deadline.
Research into options, including competitive environment critical analysis of benefits, disadvantages and risks.
Presentation skills conveying the concept clearly and with enthusiasm.
The ability to interpret and offer suitable answers to questions from the employer judging panel.
Effective teamwork in preparation and delivery of their proposal.

62761189-f4e4-4997-9369-504f29835a6e.description: This individual has an understanding of the latest software engineering methods, techniques and practices including Agile, test-driven and behaviour-driven software development, and Continuous Development and Continuous Integration. They have successfully completed a Tech Industry Gold accredited degree. Supported by employers, this meets industry skills standards for employability in entry level roles, with a holistic blend of technical, business, project and professional skills.
62761189-f4e4-4997-9369-504f29835a6e.name: Software Engineering for Business BSc- Queen Mary University London

issuer.summary: issued by TechSkills, a techUK company

alignments.name: Tech Industry Gold
alignments.description: Tech Industry Gold is the industry accreditation for tech and digital skills. Successful completers of Tech Industry Gold accredited programmes have met industry standards covering the holistic blend of technical, business, project and professional skills required for job readiness. Tech Industry Gold is led by employers and managed by TechSkills.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has successfully completed an industry-accredited degree which proved the following knowledge and skills:
A fundamental understanding of business strategy and processes, the role and management of information systems in business, information security and risk management.

Implementation of data management solutions, writing programs that use data structures, and confidently designing and applying algorithms for manipulating data in programming solutions for a variety of computational problems.
Understanding of how software design builds on software architecture considerations, including key principles such as reuse, separation of concerns and reduced cost.

Software testing, describing in detail the purpose of, and distinguishing between the different types of testing (unit, integration, systems and acceptance). This includes the role and value of test-driven development techniques, and determining appropriate testing strategies such as test automation.
Understanding of the technical foundations of systems analysis and design, software development, data management, service delivery, operations management and systems integration.

Defining configuration management processes for use throughout the product development life cycle in storing software deliverables. Controlling and tracking changes to software both at component and release level, selecting and using appropriate configuration management tools, and applying change management processes.

Deploying software, including staged deployment in to maturing prototypes and systems, depending on the organisational context into which products are deployed and the human and business issues associated with deployment.
Designing robust, scalable and future-proof software security solutions that meet specific and generic requirements, internal/external security standards and best practice.
The ability to apply modern project management methodologies to plan, deliver, manage risk and report on a technology-enabled project to achieve organisational goals.
Professional skills including written and verbal communications, teamwork, evidence-based problem solving and effective work behaviours.
